result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey Joe Golomski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $14.29 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $1.43 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Time served sentence with credit for 2 days of prior time served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsey Joe Golomski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution to Plainfield Travel Plaza - Ck No 011018

Case Called @ 3:41 PM: Defendant Lindsey Joe Golomski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Terms of agreement recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (Theft):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def: Apologizes to the Court. The Court:  Court will accept resolution.  Encourages Def to complete schooling for HS Diploma.  Imposes 2 days WCJ with 2 days TS Credit, time served sentence; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge and Sample  60 DTP or PP.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests matter be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video.

RETURN ON WARRANT - Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Lindsey Joe Golomski in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $250 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $500 Sig Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:25 am.

Case Called @ 2:38 PM: Defendant Lindsey Joe Golomski not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.  Court notes for the record that contact was made by Def yesterday to attempt adjournment - request was declined. Clerk was not able to reach Def by telephone.  Should contact be made again by Def, Vol Appearance may be arranged, though warrant will remain active until appearance.
from Defendant Re: Adjournment of 11/17/2015 IA - Court denies request for adjournment, Defendant must be present for IA.
